ExampleDefinition.Title: Mousewheel Zoom and Scroll
ExampleDefinition.ToolTipDescription:
Demonstrates mouse-wheel zooming and scrolling of SciChart.
Overlays a candlestick and line chart series on a SciChartSurface and applies the MouseWheelZoomModifier. This is a built-in ChartModifierBase derived class which adds the behavior of scrolling and zooming on mouse-wheel.
ExampleDefinition.Description: <Run FontSize="14" FontWeight="Bold">Mousewheel Zoom and Scroll</Run> <LineBreak/><LineBreak/> <Run FontSize="13">Demonstrates the many modes of operation of the MouseWheelZoomModifier. The default mode is Zoom around a point in the X and Y directions.</Run> <LineBreak/><LineBreak/> <Run FontSize="13">Additional modes are the ability to zoom in one direction only, or pan via the mouse-wheel. Try pressing CTRL or SHIFT while mouse-wheel scrolling to see the effect.</Run> <LineBreak/><LineBreak/> <Run FontSize="13">Finally, double-click to reset zoom at any time.</Run>
ExampleDefinition.HelpText: Use Mousewheel to zoom the chart, CTRL and Mouse-Wheel to scroll up/down, SHIFT and Mouse-Wheel to scroll left/right
